name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
In a pan, fry the pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and mix in the grated Parmesan cheese.
Drain the pasta, reserving some cooking water.
Mix the pasta with the pancetta, then remove from heat.
Stir in the egg mixture, adding reserved water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Marinate the chicken with turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, garam masala, and cook for a minute.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken and cook until done.
Pour in cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Thai Noodles
instructions: Cook the noodles according to package instructions and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok and sauté the garlic until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through.
Add carrot and bell pepper, cooking until slightly tender.
Stir in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and noodles.
Toss until everything is evenly coated and heated through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Tangy Manchurian
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (cabbage, carrots, ginger, bell peppers, onions)
instructions: Mix vegetables, chilli, ginger, cauliflower, flour, cornstarch, and salt. Shape into balls.
Fry vegetable balls in oil until golden brown. Set aside.
Mix a soy sauce, chilli sauce, ketchup, vinegar, sugar, and water pan.
Mix cornstarch with water. Slowly add to sauce, stirring until thickened.
Serve hot as an appetizer or with rice or noodles.
